column4: Whats the command to change directory again? for my home folder>etc, or something like that
cd
for instance, cd /home/indygunfreak/Desktop puts me on my desktop
cd /path/to/folder
i always figure if i can't smell it, its safe..lol
Good plan, haha, but I'd rather not trial and error myself to death :P
well, Ubuntu is about as easy as it gets....
Yeh, bit it does take a bit more resources to run then some of the other distros I've heard about. Problem is, I don't really remember any of the other distros I saw :P
how old a pc are we talking here?
Uh, 96mb RAM, AMD(i think) 450mhz processor, 8gb hard drive. All it's ever used for is flash games
yeah, its gonna be really tough to find a distro to work on that...
you're gonna have to looka t the small distros, Damn Small Linux, Puppy, Vector, etc.
Ah, ok. DSL would probably work? I've used that for like, 10 minutes once, it seemed decent enough.
its not bad, don't know how newb friendly it is.
Meh, I remember Firefox worked in it, hopefully Wine would to. Firefox is all that REALLY needs to work.
yeah, i'm pretty sure it comes *out of the box* with firefox, not sure on wine.
if you want to look at distros for the type of pc youre looking at, I'd suggest DSL, Vector, Puppy...
Linuxquestions.org has subforums for all 3 of them, check them out.
I did. 8.04 didnt work with my wireless out of the box like 7.10, and I don't know enough about Ubuntu to be bothered to fix it.
right click, propeties, then one of hte tabs shows it.. can't remember which
Ah, thanks xP Probably shoulda thought of that...
it happens to the best of us..
